[Page 19 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
Liverpool City Council – Guide to direct payments  
Page 18 of 21 11 Contributing towards your care costs  
Your direct payment will be made minus any financial contribution that you may be 
asked to make. Your contribution will be decided as a result of a financial 
assessment. This will calculate how much you can afford to contribute toward the 
cost of your care. More information on contributions is available on the council 
website at liverpool.gov.uk/payingforcare.  
In most cases you will be asked to deposit your contribution into your direct 
payments account. You will receive a statement from us telling you how much you 
have to pay every four weeks.

[Page 8 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
Liverpool City Council – Disabled Facilities Gra nt Policy 
Page 7 of 20 7 Means Tested Contributions  
7.1 As part of the standard DFG application process a standard test of 
resources is undertaken to determine whether the applicant needs to 
make a financial contribution toward the cost of works undertaken. 
Liverpool City Council has however agreed to use its discretion under the 
Regulatory Reform Order to provide a ‘non -means tested’ DFG where the 
value of proposed works are less than £6,000. The Regulatory Reform 
Order (RRO) provides Liverpool City Council with increased powers to 
introduce policies to assist  clients with adaptations to their homes. This 
can be provided direct and follows the changes made in 2008 to the way 
in which DFGs can be administered, increasing flexibility and being able 
to direct funds towards wider strategic projects, with the remova l of the 
ring fencing of DFG funds. Appendix B outlines examples of RRO 
policies.

[Page 12 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
Liverpool City Council – Charging for non -residential care services  
Page 11 of 41 6 Disability related expenditure  
The CASS guidance (Annex C) provides details of what expenses and costs the  
authority should consider when determining disability -related expenditure (DRE). 
This financial assessment must make an assessment and allow the person to keep 
enough benefit to pay for necessary disability -related expenditure to meet any needs 
which are not being met by the council.   
LCC will disregard a locally agreed rate of DRE allowance where the person 
receives the following benefits:  
• Attendance Allowance   
• Disability Living Allowance (middle /high rate of the care component)  
• Personal Independence Payment (daily living component).  
This locally agreed rate will be reviewed periodically, usually annually. Should a 
person feel that the allowance awarded does not accurately reflect their disability -

[Page 11 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
Liverpool City Council – Disabled Facilities Gra nt Policy 
Page 10 of 20 11.2 In addition,  any recipient of a DFG that has a homeowner’s interest in the 
property that has had any adaptation carried out and subs equently moves 
property within the Liverpool City Council boundary and is seeking further 
grant aid to install similar adaptations to those previously funded then any 
cost over £5,000 will also be subject to a land charge.   
11.3 Where charges are levied, then in each case Liverpool City Council must 
be satisfied that it is reasonable to require the repayment and will 
consider this in line with the legislation.
